location: The temple of Diana at Ephesus THAISA standing

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: Hail, Dian! to perform thy just command, I here confess myself the king of Tyre Who, frighted from my country, did wed At Pentapolis the fair Thaisa. At sea in childbed died she, but brought forth A maidchild calld Marina who, O goddess, Wears yet thy silver livery. She at Tarsus Was nursed with Cleon who at fourteen years He sought to murder: but her better stars Brought her to Mytilene gainst whose shore Riding, her fortunes brought the maid aboard us, Where, by her own most clear remembrance, she Made known herself my daughter.

lines.speaker: thaisa
lines.text: Voice and favour! You are, you areO royal Pericles!
Faints

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: What means the nun she dies! help, gentlemen!

lines.speaker: cerimon
lines.text: Noble sir, If you have told Dianas altar true, This is your wife.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: Reverend appearer, no I threw her overboard with these very arms.

lines.speaker: cerimon
lines.text: Upon this coast, I warrant you.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: Tis most certain.

lines.speaker: cerimon
lines.text: Look to the lady O, shes but oerjoyd. Early in blustering morn this lady was Thrown upon this shore. I oped the coffin, Found there rich jewels recoverd her, and placed her Here in Dianas temple.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: May we see them

lines.speaker: cerimon
lines.text: Great sir, they shall be brought you to my house, Whither I invite you. Look, Thaisa is recovered.

lines.speaker: thaisa
lines.text: O, let me look! If he be none of mine, my sanctity Will to my sense bend no licentious ear, But curb it, spite of seeing. O, my lord, Are you not Pericles Like him you spake, Like him you are: did you not name a tempest, A birth, and death

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: The voice of dead Thaisa!

lines.speaker: thaisa
lines.text: That Thaisa am I, supposed dead And drownd.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: Immortal Dian!

lines.speaker: thaisa
lines.text: Now I know you better. When we with tears parted Pentapolis, The king my father gave you such a ring.
Shows a ring

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: This, this: no more, you gods! your present kindness Makes my past miseries sports: you shall do well, That on the touching of her lips I may Melt and no more be seen. O, come, be buried A second time within these arms.

lines.speaker: marina
lines.text: My heart Leaps to be gone into my mothers bosom.
Kneels to THAISA

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: Look, who kneels here! Flesh of thy flesh, Thaisa Thy burden at the sea, and calld Marina For she was yielded there.

lines.speaker: thaisa
lines.text: Blest, and mine own!

lines.speaker: helicanus
lines.text: Hail, madam, and my queen!

lines.speaker: thaisa
lines.text: I know you not.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: You have heard me say, when I did fly from Tyre, I left behind an ancient substitute: Can you remember what I calld the man I have named him oft.

lines.speaker: thaisa
lines.text: Twas Helicanus then.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: Still confirmation: Embrace him, dear Thaisa this is he. Now do I long to hear how you were found How possibly preserved and who to thank, Besides the gods, for this great miracle.

lines.speaker: thaisa
lines.text: Lord Cerimon, my lord this man, Through whom the gods have shown their power that can From first to last resolve you.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: Reverend sir, The gods can have no mortal officer More like a god than you. Will you deliver How this dead queen relives

lines.speaker: cerimon
lines.text: I will, my lord. Beseech you, first go with me to my house, Where shall be shown you all was found with her How she came placed here in the temple No needful thing omitted.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: Pure Dian, bless thee for thy vision! I Will offer nightoblations to thee. Thaisa, This prince, the fairbetrothed of your daughter, Shall marry her at Pentapolis. And now, This ornament Makes me look dismal will I clip to form And what this fourteen years no razor touchd, To grace thy marriageday, Ill beautify.

lines.speaker: thaisa
lines.text: Lord Cerimon hath letters of good credit, sir, My fathers dead.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: Heavens make a star of him! Yet there, my queen, Well celebrate their nuptials, and ourselves Will in that kingdom spend our following days: Our son and daughter shall in Tyrus reign. Lord Cerimon, we do our longing stay To hear the rest untold: sir, leads the way.
Exeunt
Enter GOWER

lines.speaker: gower
lines.text: In Antiochus and his daughter you have heard Of monstrous lust the due and just reward: In Pericles, his queen and daughter, seen, Although assaild with fortune fierce and keen, Virtue preserved from fell destructions blast, Led on by heaven, and crownd with joy at last: In Helicanus may you well descry A figure of truth, of faith, of loyalty: In reverend Cerimon there well appears The worth that learned charity aye wears: For wicked Cleon and his wife, when fame Had spread their cursed deed, and honourd name Of Pericles, to rage the city turn, That him and his they in his palace burn The gods for murder seemed so content To punish them although not done, but meant. So, on your patience evermore attending, New joy wait on you! Here our play has ending.
Exit
